column1: Uchi////On to the menu....you need someone to walk you through it especially if you have as many limitations at your table as we did.  We were dealing with kosher
column2: gluten free and no raw fish...the waiter was able to help us find great dishes to share and make everyone happy.  The menu is hard to navigate without help
column3: so come prepared to explore and ask a lot of questions.  Everything is intended for sharing
column4: so everyone had a few bites.  There is something to be said about having an entree to devour yourself
column5: but Uchi is a food adventure.  It's fun to have a few bites
column6: but it does leave you wanting more of the dishes you especially love.
